title: Back to Back Stemplot: Mini Golf
question_text:
Bart and Lisa each played the same 18 hole mini golf course fourteen times. Their scores are recorded below. Which of the following statements are TRUE?
Key: 3|1=31.
tables:
Stem
Bart (1)(10)Lisa (1)
129
1111113999999
9999994111111
951

choices.text: Bart and Lisa’s scores have the same general shape.
Bart and Lisa’s scores have the same range.
Bart and Lisa’s scores have the same standard deviation.
Bart’s scores have a higher mean than Lisa’s.
Bart’s scores have a higher range than Lisa’s.

solution:
This question shows a drawback of stem and leaf plots. If you only look at the shape and do not look closely, you will think that $21$ and $29$ are the same. They both go in the same row of the graph.

However, $29$ is more similar to $31$ than to $21$ even though $29$ and $31$ are in different rows. Bart’s range is $59 - 21 = 38$, and Lisa’s range is $51 - 29 = 22$.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice ‘A’ is incorrect because Bart’s scores are very bimodal, and Lisa’s scores are unimodal with a small spread. Most of Lisa’s scores are between $39$ and $41$, while Bart has a cluster at $31$ and another cluster at $49$. It is not enough to just look at the shape of the stem and leaf plot. You must also read the actual numbers. If this information had been presented as a dot plot, then the shape difference would be quite obvious.

Choice ‘B’ is incorrect because Bart’s scores range from $59 -21 = 38$, and Lisa’s scores range from $51 - 29 = 22$.

Choice ‘C’ is incorrect because Bart’s scores are much more spread out and have a much higher standard deviation.

Choice ‘D’ is incorrect because both Bart and Lisa have a mean of exactly $40$.
